basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ Hello! I'm a soon-to-be graduate from the University of Massachusetts, passionate about all things tech. Skilled in both front-end and back-end development, I have a keen interest in machine learning and its applications. As I step into the professional world, I'm eager to apply my skills to solve real-world problems and innovate within the tech industry.

projects.title: Ancient Ruins Game
projects.description: For my game development class, I took on the exciting challenge of creating a game set in ancient ruins. The game was built using Unity and throughout the project, I learned to implement a variety of technologies and received valuable feedback from my professor.

projects.title: Office Hours Scheduler
projects.description: As part of a group assignment, I contributed to the development of an Office Hours Scheduler website aimed at streamlining the appointment process for academic consultations. Within our team, my primary role was in front-end development, where I was responsible for creating an intuitive user interface that allows students and faculty to effortlessly schedule appointments.

projects.title: Flappy Block Game
projects.description: I made a game to learn more about game development. Itâ€™s similar to Flappy Bird where you help a block avoid obstacles by clicking to make it fly. This was a personal project I did before taking a game development class, and it helped me get started with making games.

projects.title: Algorithm Visualizer
projects.description: One of the first personal projects, I developed a Pathfinding Visualizer to demonstrate and compare the effectiveness of various algorithms in finding the shortest path. This interactive tool visually represents how different algorithms, like Dijkstraâ€™s and A*, navigate through a grid to reach a target.
